required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Response Of Weight And Lipid Profile To Exercise Time In Sedentary Overweight/Obese Middle-Aged And Older Women
clinical_study.official_title: Response Of Weight And Lipid Profile To Exercise Time In Sedentary Overweight/Obese Middle-Aged And Older Women

lead_sponsor.agency: P.L.Shupik National Medical Academy of Post-Graduate Education

clinical_study.source: P.L.Shupik National Medical Academy of Post-Graduate Education

brief_summary.textblock: The exercise time is an important factor among the medical guides for weight loss; however, there is still little knowledge about exercise duration paths in middle-aged and older women. The present study aimed to determine the effects of the interval training on weight loss and lipid profile, and to compare its efficiency with the continuous training.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants included sedentary women (age 45-75 years) with overweight or obesity (n= 115). They were randomly divided into two groups including continuous exercise, and interval exercise. The weight assessment parameters including change in weight and body composition, blood sample tests were performed pre- and three month post-intervention.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

arm_group.description: Study group I (57 participants) received the continuous training of exercise time.
Study group II (58 participants) received the interval training of exercise time.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Sedentary lifestyle
- Good Health
- Weight stability
Exclusion Criteria:
*Abnormality or history of Disease

overall_official.affiliation: Member of Scientific Board in Physical Education and Sport Sciences
